channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: MLB pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches
item.description: Two Major League Baseball pitchers have been indicted on charges they took bribes to give bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they'd throw and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes.
item.content:encoded:
Two Major League Baseball pitchers have been indicted on charges they took bribes to give bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they'd throw and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes.

(Image credit: Sue Ogrocki)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Some UPS and FedEx planes are grounded. What does that mean for holiday shipping?
item.description: UPS and FedEx's fleets of MD-11 planes are grounded, which can each carry thousands of packages. Logistics experts say some cargo could shift to passenger planes, trains and trucks.
item.content:encoded:
UPS and FedEx's fleets of MD-11 planes are grounded, which can each carry thousands of packages. Logistics experts say some cargo could shift to passenger planes, trains and trucks.

(Image credit: Wilfredo Lee)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner for 17 years, dies at 84
item.description: Paul Tagliabue, who helped bring labor peace and riches to the NFL during his 17 years as commissioner but was criticized for not taking stronger action on concussions, died on Sunday at 84 years old.
item.content:encoded:
Paul Tagliabue, who helped bring labor peace and riches to the NFL during his 17 years as commissioner but was criticized for not taking stronger action on concussions, died on Sunday at 84 years old.

(Image credit: Ed Andrieski)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: BBC director resigns after criticism of the broadcaster's editing of a Trump speech
item.description: The BBC said that director-general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness have resigned after criticism of the broadcaster's editing of a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The BBC said that director-general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness have resigned after criticism of the broadcaster's editing of a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Hannah McKay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump admin tells states to 'immediately undo' steps to fund November SNAP benefits
item.description: The Trump administration late Saturday directed states that they must "immediately undo" any actions they have made to provide benefits to low-income families via SNAP.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration late Saturday directed states that they must "immediately undo" any actions they have made to provide benefits to low-income families via SNAP.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Israel receives remains of hostage that Hamas says is IDF soldier killed in 2014
item.description: Hadar Goldin was killed on Aug. 1, 2014, two hours after a ceasefire took effect ending that year's war between Israel and Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
Hadar Goldin was killed on Aug. 1, 2014, two hours after a ceasefire took effect ending that year's war between Israel and Hamas.

(Image credit: Mahmoud Illean)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A first-time HPV vaccination campaign sees some success -- and strong resistance
item.description: The goal: inoculate 90% of girls in parts of Pakistan to immunize them against the infection that causes cervical cancer. "Our biggest challenge was to counter misinformation," says a spokesman.
item.content:encoded:
The goal: inoculate 90% of girls in parts of Pakistan to immunize them against the infection that causes cervical cancer. "Our biggest challenge was to counter misinformation," says a spokesman.

(Image credit: Betsy Joles for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Text and photos by Betsy Joles

item.title: Fedora man unmasked: Meet the teen behind the Louvre mystery photo
item.description: "I didn't want to say immediately it was me," fifteen-year-old Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux said. "With this photo there is a mystery, so you have to make it last."
item.content:encoded:
"I didn't want to say immediately it was me," fifteen-year-old Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux said. "With this photo there is a mystery, so you have to make it last."

(Image credit: Thibault Camus)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Many would-be buyers are frozen out of the housing market
item.description: Only about one in five homes sold in the last year went to a first-time buyer. And the average person buying their first home was 40 years old — a record high. A new report from the National Association of Realtors shows how challenging it's become for young people to get a foothold in today's costly housing market.
item.content:encoded:
Only about one in five homes sold in the last year went to a first-time buyer. And the average person buying their first home was 40 years old — a record high. A new report from the National Association of Realtors shows how challenging it's become for young people to get a foothold in today's costly housing market.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Nearly a million people evacuate as Super Typhoon Fung-wong threatens the Philippines
item.description: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday.

(Image credit: Malacanang Presidential Communications Office)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
